data.title: Jason Terry isn't surprised that the Bulls are up 2-0 over Celtics
data.meta_description: While it may come as a surprise to a lot of people that the eighth-seed Chicago Bulls are leading the top-seeded Boston Celtics 2-0 in Round 1 of the NBA playoffs, don’t count Milwaukee Buck and SiriusXM NBA Radio host … Continued
data.text:
While it may come as a surprise to a lot of people that the eighth-seed Chicago Bulls are leading the top-seeded Boston Celtics 2-0 in Round 1 of the NBA playoffs, don’t count Milwaukee Buck and SiriusXM NBA Radio host Jason Terry among them.

“Before the season, I picked them to come out of the East to upset Cleveland, if I wasn’t on the Milwaukee Bucks,” Terry said. “These guys don’t lack confidence at all.”

Despite breezing through the first two games on the road, Terry still thinks there’s a long way to go before the Bulls can claim the upset in the early rounds.

“To finish off that series, though, I can tell you right now it’s going to be a dogfight,” Terry said. “It’s not going to be as easy as it was those first two games, but I’m a little concerned right now for Boston.”

Catch the latest on the playoffs on SiriusXM NBA Radio, XM Ch. 86, Sirius Ch. 207.

Photo: AP Photo/Charles Krupa
